gdouble gqr_finite_part ( gdouble  a,
gdouble  b,
gdouble  y,
gdouble  g 
)

Compute the finite part integral using the method of Brandao, M. P., 1987, `Improper integrals in theoretical aerodynamics: The problem revisited', AIAA Journal, 25(9):1258--1260.

Parameters:
a lower limit of integration;
b upper limit of integration;
y location of singularity;
g order of singularity, .
Returns:
finite part of .

gdouble gqr_finite_part_integral ( gqr_func  f,
gpointer  data,
gdouble  y,
gdouble  gm,
gdouble  a,
gdouble  b,
gqr_rule_t *  g 
)

Compute the finite part integral using a Gaussian quadrature for the regular integral. The method is that of Brandao, M. P., 1987, `Improper integrals in theoretical aerodynamics: The problem revisited', AIAA Journal, 25(9):1258--1260.

Parameters:
f a gqr_func which returns the th derivative of the function;
data data to pass to f;
y position of the singularity;
gm strength (exponent) of the singularity;
a lower limit of integration;
b upper limit of integration;
g Gaussian quadrature rule for the regular integral.
Returns:
the finite part of .

References gqr_finite_part(), and gqr_rule_scale().
